item.title: Michelle add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "That boy is your company. And if he wants to eat up that tablecloth, you let him, you hear?" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world." -- Voltaire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "â€ŽLife is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Michelle add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Michelle add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I am not sure that I exist, actually. I am all the writers that I have read, all the people that I have met, all the women that I have loved; all the cities I have visited." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "Always be a poet, even in prose." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk." -- Charles Baudelaire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Baudelaire
item.description: "A multitude of small delights constitute happiness" -- Charles Baudelaire
